intro: Crotalaria somalensis subsp. fusula, commonly known as the Somali Crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to dry conditions. Its seed pods are distinctive, often containing several small, angular seeds. This subspecies is of interest for its potential ecological and medicinal properties.
